messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Diane's deathday celebration
messages.msgSnippet: ... And I realized later that perhaps some people don t realize Dios is Spanish for God. I believe I remember Sandra saying that when her Jr High students
messages.messageBody:
on 9/5/03 4:17 AM, Fetteroll at fetteroll@... wrote:

>> I don't even know where that Dios came from.
>
> Must have come from God ;-)

And I realized later that perhaps some people don't realize Dios is Spanish
for God.

I believe I remember Sandra saying that when her Jr High students asked "Why
do we have to learn this stuff?" she answered, "So you can get the jokes."
:-)

Joyce

messages.subject: Diane's deathday celebration
messages.msgSnippet: Dia de los Muertos (easier to google ) THank you....duh. I don t even know where that Dios came from. I guess that s what happens when you re in a hurry and
messages.messageBody:
Dia de los Muertos
(easier to google <g>)


THank you....duh. I don't even know where that Dios came from. I guess that's what happens when you're in a hurry and have WAY too much on the brain.

Our Funfest is this weekend, I'm gaining a whole new level of sympathy for Kelly, and ours is just a one day event without nearly the amount of stuff to schedule. I'm exhausted.

Ren
